context.p: Eucalyptus requires that each machine have the Network Time Protocol (NTP) daemon started and configured to run automatically on reboot.

step.cmd: Install NTP on the machines that will host Eucalyptus components.

choices.choice: For CentOS 5, RHEL 5, and RHEL 6, run yum install ntp
For Ubuntu 10.04 LTS, run apt-get install openntpd

step.cmd: Open the /etc/ntp.conf file (/etc/openntpd/ntpd.conf in Ubuntu) and add NTP servers, as in the following example.
Configure NTP to run at reboot. (In Ubuntu, NTP is configured after you install it.)
Start NTP. (In Ubuntu, NTP starts after you install it.)
Synchronize your system clock, so that when your system is rebooted, it does not get out of sync.
Repeat on each host that will run a Eucalyptus component.
